channel.title: Ron Paul
channel.description: I think we all need to vote for Ron Paul because all the things that he has said has been positive and will help the country so much more than Obama has and ever will do. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FG2PUZoukfA

item.title: Ron Paul
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Niall:

[quote author=Pblord7 link=topic=533226.msg3897742#msg3897742 date=1327460299]all the things that he has said has been positive and will help the country

you mean like signing the sanctity of life act meaning life begins at conception in a legal setting, making abortions illegal on the federal level?

No… All of the black people that NEVER vote before decide to vote since there’s another black man running for president.

the amount of black people that voted in 2008 wasn’t even a significant amount more than usual

maybe if obamas main opposition was someone other than cain and the nutjob palin he wouldn’t have won[/quote]
state level*

Read full topic

item.title: Ron Paul
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Same amount voted, but it was skewed. 98% of blacks voted for Obama, not to mention the amount of voter fraud (people voting under the names micky mouse etc) that acorn turned their cheek. Acorn asking who you’re voting for (they aren’t supposed to) and if you answered cain then they would say they can’t find your name in the book.

http://www.google.com/search?sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8&q=acorn+vote+fraud

http://www.google.com/search?sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8&q=acorn+vote+micky+mouse

He won’t win this time because he doesn’t have all the strings attached.

rip4d:

The legalization of it would actually stop a lot of problems and possibly aid in the economy of the country. Think about it this way, it would be regulated by the government, and the proceeds would go to the government. We wouldn’t need to import it, as we could grow it here. It would be safer because it is regulated, and would stop it from being laced with other drugs. The legalization would be a good thing, and I don’t even want to smoke it, I’m just looking at it from a logical viewpoint.

+1 atleast you aren’t spreading bullshit like it cures cancer immediately or you can make paper out of it. I can’t stand pot heads going around preaching that crap. They know they don’t give a shit and they just want to smoke.

And no, sadly, it would be cheaper to grow it in other countries and import it and thats exactly what companies will do, which means more money to regulate it.

Read full topic

item.title: Ron Paul
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

]If you are basing our president, one of the most powerful men in the world, on his race, you need a reality check and come back to the 21st century.

You need to realise that you’re not the only one voting too. While you may be aware of what is happening, many others aren’t and will gladly vote for a president in exchange for shallow promises and monetary gain. Take Egypt for an example: most of the candidates for parliament promised the people in their area that they would give them money in exchange for their votes. It’s sad too because the money they promised is the equivalent of around $10 (really negligible amount).

Read full topic

item.title: Ron Paul
item.dc:creator: @frozon566 frozon566
item.description:
@frozon566 wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:13, topic:430546”][quote author=Pblord7 link=topic=533226.msg3897832#msg3897832 date=1327468145]

Because every president that sounds like a hero turns out to be a hero.

Remember when Obama saved America from the economic crisis?

If we wasn’t black he wouldn’t have won.

he didn’t win because he was black. he won because he is mentally handicapped and the feds can do whatever they want with him. he’s just a toy. dr. paul isn’t the best guy in the world, but he’s a hell of a lot better than the other power-hungry faggots like newt gingcock and dick romfaggotry.

No… All of the black people that NEVER vote before decide to vote since there’s another black man running for president.
[/quote]If you are basing our president, one of the most powerful men in the world, on his race, you need a reality check and come back to the 21st century.[/quote]

if you aren’t then you need to realise the world isn’t a utopia.
